Manages a V1 volume resource within OpenStack.

{{% examples %}}
## Example Usage

{{< chooser language "typescript,python,go,csharp" / >}}

{{% example csharp %}}
```csharp
using Pulumi;
using OpenStack = Pulumi.OpenStack;

class MyStack : Stack
{
    public MyStack()
    {
        var volume1 = new OpenStack.BlockStorage.VolumeV1("volume1", new OpenStack.BlockStorage.VolumeV1Args
        {
            Description = "first test volume",
            Region = "RegionOne",
            Size = 3,
        });
    }

}
```

{{% /example %}}

{{% example go %}}
```go
package main

import (
	"github.com/pulumi/pulumi-openstack/sdk/v2/go/openstack/blockstorage"
	"github.com/pulumi/pulumi/sdk/v2/go/pulumi"
)

func main() {
	pulumi.Run(func(ctx *pulumi.Context) error {
		_, err := blockstorage.NewVolumeV1(ctx, "volume1", &blockstorage.VolumeV1Args{
			Description: pulumi.String("first test volume"),
			Region:      pulumi.String("RegionOne"),
			Size:        pulumi.Int(3),
		})
		if err != nil {
			return err
		}
		return nil
	})
}
```

{{% /example %}}

### Outputs

All [input](#inputs) properties are implicitly available as output properties. Additionally, the VolumeV1 resource produces the following output properties:




{{% choosable language csharp %}}

            title="">
        <span id="attachments_csharp">

    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}If a volume is attached to an instance, this attribute will
display the Attachment ID, Instance ID, and the Device as the Instance
sees it.
